Comment: And the 2nd amendment was mainly added because the Founding Fathers feared the state ever infringing on militias. At the time, England used its large standing army to oppress the people. The English government mandated that the colonies must maintain the troops at colonists' expense. This meant that colonists who began to see themselves more and more as American rather than English had to house loyalist Redcoats in their homes or on their properties.   This was the infringement they were concerned about. But it became obvious that relying on militias instead of a standing army is a stupid idea during the War of 1812 and the Spanish War.
